title: Google\Cloud\Vision\Annotation\Entity
name: Entity
description: Represents an entity annotation. Entities are created by several Google Cloud Vision features, namely LANDMARK_DETECTION, LOGO_DETECTION, LABEL_DETECTION and TEXT_DETECTION.

methods.name: __construct
methods.description:
Create an entity annotation result.

This class is created internally by Google\Cloud\Vision\Annotation and is used to represent various annotation feature results.

This class should not be instantiated externally.

Entities are returned by Google\Cloud\Vision\Annotation::landmarks(), Google\Cloud\Vision\Annotation::logos(), Google\Cloud\Vision\Annotation::labels() and Google\Cloud\Vision\Annotation::text().

methods.name: mid
methods.description:
Opaque entity ID.

Some IDs might be available in Knowledge Graph(KG).

methods.name: locale
methods.description: The language code for the locale in which the entity textual description (next field) is expressed.

methods.name: description
methods.description: Entity textual description, expressed in its locale language.

methods.name: confidence
methods.description:
The accuracy of the entity detection in an image.

For example, for an image containing 'Eiffel Tower,' this field represents the confidence that there is a tower in the query image.

Range [0, 1].

methods.name: topicality
methods.description:
The relevancy of the ICA (Image Content Annotation) label to the image.

For example, the relevancy of 'tower' to an image containing 'Eiffel Tower' is likely higher than an image containing a distant towering building, though the confidence that there is a tower may be the same.

Range [0, 1].

methods.name: boundingPoly
methods.description:
Image region to which this entity belongs.

Not filled currently for LABEL_DETECTION features. For TEXT_DETECTION (OCR), boundingPolys are produced for the entire text detected in an image region, followed by boundingPolys for each word within the detected text.

methods.name: locations
methods.description:
The location information for the detected entity.

Multiple LocationInfo elements can be present since one location may indicate the location of the scene in the query image, and another the location of the place where the query image was taken. Location information is usually present for landmarks.

methods.name: properties
methods.description: Some entities can have additional optional Property fields. For example a different kind of score or string that qualifies the entity.
